sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些前置词或前置短语都含有"虽然，尽管"之意。
means: despite ： 书面用词，指不受某事或某种原因的阻碍，语气轻于in spite of。
in spite of ： 在这些词中语气最强，可与despite换用，口语或书面语中均可使用。
notwithstanding ： 语气最弱，仅表示一种障碍的存在。

sentence.Network_en: She persevered in her idea despite obvious objections raised by friends.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然朋友们明确反对，她还是坚持己见。

sentence.Network_en: Despite his lack of experience, he got the job.
sentence.Network_cn: 他虽然经验不足，但还是获得了这份工作。

sentence.Network_en: Despite his bulk he moved lightly on his feet.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管他身形庞大，移动起来还是很灵巧。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 自考英语二词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... incidence n. 影响程度，影响范围；发生率 despite prep. 尽管，任凭 deport vt. 驱逐出境.
大英语B级词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... desperate adj. 不顾一切的,绝望的 despite prep. 不管,尽管,不论 disgusting adj. 令人厌恶的.
自考英语二词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... incidence n. 影响程度，影响范围；发生率 despite prep. 尽管，任凭 deport vt. 驱逐出境.
That ' s why , despite the attention and adulation , his real name remains a well - kept secret ., 这就是为什麽尽管如此地被关注和奉承 , 他的真是姓名依然非常好地得到保密.

list.abs: despite the bitter cold , there was hardly any snowfall in this region so that all the cross-country and skiing slopes have to be made with artificial snow .尽管天气严寒，这些地区仍然没有下雪，所以该地的越野滑雪道都必须施放人工雪。

despite the recession , her approval rating has soared to 72 % , up from 40 % in June 2008 , according to polls by the Centre for Public Studies ( CEP ) , a think-tank .根据智库政府研究中心（CEP)的民调显示，尽管经济衰退，但她的支持度已上升至七成二，从2008年6月的四成大幅升高。
At the same time , despite international monetary crises , Ontario ' s industry flourished , especially the construction industry ., 然而与此同时尽管国际货币危机 , 安省工业还是繁荣发展 , 特别在建筑业.

demand has pushed up the cost of a small tent fourfold , residents complain , despite government orders to retailers to rein in prices of relief-related materials .居民抱怨说，由于供不应求，尽管政府已经对零售商下达命令，严格控制救灾物资的价格，小型帐篷的价格还是飞涨到了原先的四倍。

girls Name When our daughter was born , we named her Myles , after my beloved late father , despite family warning that the name was too masculine .女孩的名字女儿出生时，我们给她取名叫迈尔斯，和我深爱的已过世的父亲同一个名字，不顾家人提醒这个名字太男性化了。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that one did not intend or expect to do the thing mentioned
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不由自主地；身不由己地

lj.lj_ly: despite herself Fran felt a ripple of appreciation for his beauty.
lj.lj_ls: 弗兰不由自主地感受到了他的勃勃英姿。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally used as a noun meaning contempt, scorn in the phrase in despite of): from Old French despit, from Latin despectus 'looking down on', past participle (used as a noun) of despicere (see despise)

entry.def: You use despite to introduce a fact which makes the other part of the sentence surprising.

example.ex: Despite a thorough investigation, no trace of Dr Southwell has been found...
example.tran: 尽管进行了彻底的调查，还是没有发现索思韦尔博士的任何踪迹。

example.ex: The National Health Service has visibly deteriorated, despite increased spending...
example.tran: 尽管支出在增加，但国民医疗保健服务的质量却明显下降了。

entry.def: If you do something despite yourself you do it although you did not really intend or expect to.

example.ex: Despite myself, Harry's remarks had caused me to stop and reflect.
example.tran: 哈里的话让我不由自主地停下来细想。

means.word_mean: 1. lack of respect accompanied by a feeling of intense dislike;

sentences.sentence: "the despite in which outsiders were held is legendary"

auth_sentence.content: Despite his doubts he has nothing to worry about.
auth_sentence.res_content: Despite his doubts he has nothing to worry about.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Despite his doubts he has nothing to worry about.

auth_sentence.content: Despite events on the pitch the mood was upbeat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Despite events on the pitch the mood was upbeat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Despite events on the pitch the mood was upbeat.

auth_sentence.content: Despite the bright green colour it is well camouflaged.
auth_sentence.res_content: Despite the bright green colour it is well camouflaged.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Despite the bright green colour it is well camouflaged.

stems_affixes.word_buile: con大家+spic看+uous……的→大家都看见→显眼的
de向下+spic看+able能……的→能向下看的→可鄙视的
per全部+spic看+acious多……的→全部看到→独具慧眼
sus下面+spic看+ious……的→在下面看的→suspicious怀疑的
suspicious[adj.[of]可疑的,多疑的,疑心的]+ly表副词→adv.猜疑着, 怀疑着
sus下面+spic看+ion表名词→在下面看→suspicion怀疑

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不管, 尽管, 不论
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉+spite=spic看→不看→不管, 尽管

Sentence.sentence: It is widely consumed despite its ill reputation.
And despite what you may believe about the limits of your own creative imaginations, we all have the potential to imagine the world in an absolutely new way.
But despite this, our children are growing up nature-deprived (丧失).
Despite its failure to shatter the glass ceiling,Sweden has one of the most powerful and innovative economies in the world.
Despite bottoming out in 1933, the Depression didn't end until World War II.
That seems like common sense, despite the multiple influences on becoming parents

means.word_mean: 不管, 尽管, 任凭

sentences.en: Despite the fact that she is short, she is an excellent basketball player.
sentences.cn: 尽管她个子矮, 却是个出色的篮球运动员。

jushi.english: Despite what others say,I think this film is very good.
jushi.chinese: 不管别人怎么说,我仍认为这部电影很好看。

jushi.english: Despite a shortage of steel, industrial output has increased by five percent.
jushi.chinese: 尽管钢材供应不足,工业产量仍增长5％。
